title: Visualizing the world's Twitter data - Jer Thorp

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Speed is a measurement of how fast an object moves, while velocity is a measurement of how slow an object moves.

title: The historical audacity of the Louisiana Purchase - Judy Walton

multiple-choice.question: What was Thomas Jefferson's main concern about the new constitution presented in 1787?

options.label: A
options.text: It gave too much power to the states.

options.label: B
options.text: It gave too much power to the national government.

options.label: C
options.text: It did not provide enough individual rights.

options.label: D
options.text: It did not establish a national bank.

multiple-choice.question: Why did Thomas Jefferson initially oppose the establishment of a national bank in 1790?

options.label: A
options.text: He believed it would lead to inflation.

options.label: B
options.text: He believed it was unconstitutional.

options.label: C
options.text: He believed it would favor the wealthy.

options.label: D
options.text: He believed it would lead to economic downturn.

multiple-choice.question: What was the original plan of Congress regarding the Louisiana Territory?

options.label: A
options.text: To buy the entire territory from France.

options.label: B
options.text: To buy a piece of the territory along the Mississippi River.

options.label: C
options.text: To negotiate a trade agreement with France.

options.label: D
options.text: To declare war on France.

multiple-choice.question: How did Thomas Jefferson justify the purchase of the Louisiana Territory?

options.label: A
options.text: He claimed it was explicitly permitted by The Constitution.

options.label: B
options.text: He claimed it was implied in The Constitution's treaty-making power.

options.label: C
options.text: He claimed it was necessary for national security.

options.label: D
options.text: He claimed it was a good economic investment.

multiple-choice.question: What is ironic about Thomas Jefferson's role in the Louisiana Purchase?

options.label: A
options.text: He was a strong supporter of big government.

options.label: B
options.text: He was a strict constructionist who used implied powers to justify the purchase.

options.label: C
options.text: He was opposed to the purchase but was overruled by Congress.

options.label: D
options.text: He was not involved in the negotiations with France.

title: How polarity makes water behave strangely - Christina Kleinberg

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary reason why some insects are able to walk on the surface of a pond?

options.label: A
options.text: The insects have a special type of foot that allows them to grip the water.

options.label: B
options.text: The surface tension of the water creates a thin film that gives enough resistance for the insects to walk on.

options.label: C
options.text: The insects are able to generate a powerful force that allows them to walk on the water.

options.label: D
options.text: The water is frozen, allowing the insects to walk on it.

multiple-choice.question: Why do lakes freeze from the top down in winter?

options.label: A
options.text: Because the water molecules are more dense in the solid state than in the liquid state.

options.label: B
options.text: Because the water molecules are less dense in the solid state than in the liquid state.

options.label: C
options.text: Because the water molecules are equally dense in both the solid and liquid states.

options.label: D
options.text: Because the water molecules are not affected by temperature changes.

options.label: A
options.text: Polarity

options.label: B
options.text: Cohesion

options.label: C
options.text: Adhesion

options.label: D
options.text: Hydrogen bonding

options.label: B
options.text: Ionic bond

options.label: C
options.text: Hydrogen bond

options.label: D
options.text: Polar bond

options.label: A
options.text: Because of its high density

options.label: B
options.text: Because of its low density

options.label: C
options.text: Because of its polarity and the resulting hydrogen bonding

options.label: D

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: They took it off quickly to minimize pain.

options.label: C
options.text: They asked him which method he preferred.

options.label: D
options.text: They didn't take off his bandages.

options.label: A
options.text: That people prefer high-intensity, short-duration pain.

options.label: B
options.text: That people prefer low-intensity, long-duration pain.

options.label: C
options.text: That people's perception of pain is not affected by duration.

options.label: D
options.text: That people's perception of pain is not affected by intensity.

options.label: A
options.text: That most people cheat a lot when given the opportunity.

options.label: B
options.text: That most people cheat a little when given the opportunity.

options.label: C
options.text: That people only cheat when they think they won't get caught.

options.label: D
options.text: That people never cheat, even when given the opportunity.

options.label: A
options.text: That recalling the Ten Commandments increased cheating.

options.label: B
options.text: That recalling the Ten Commandments decreased cheating.

options.label: C
options.text: That recalling the Ten Commandments had no effect on cheating.

options.label: D
options.text: That people who recalled the Ten Commandments cheated more than those who didn't.

multiple-choice.question: What did the speaker's experiment with the tokens and dollars reveal about cheating?

options.label: A
options.text: That people cheat more when they are paid in dollars.

options.label: B
options.text: That people cheat more when they are paid in tokens.

options.label: C
options.text: That people cheat the same amount whether they are paid in dollars or tokens.

options.label: D
options.text: That people don't cheat at all when they are paid in tokens.
